message.content: This question requires knowledge about the different types of animals and their body temperature regulation. Only option (C) is correct because birds, like the robin, are warm-blooded animals, meaning they can regulate their body temperature internally. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because lizards and pythons are cold-blooded animals, meaning their body temperature is regulated by their environment. Option (D) is nonsensical because rocks are inanimate objects and do not have bodily functions or temperature regulation.

This question tests knowledge about the type of blood found in different organisms. Warm-blooded organisms are able to regulate their body temperature internally, whereas cold-blooded organisms rely on external sources to regulate their body temperature. A robin is a warm-blooded bird, so option (C) is the correct answer. 

Option (A) is incorrect because lizards are cold-blooded. Option (B) is also incorrect because pythons are cold-blooded. Option (D) is obviously incorrect because rocks are not living organisms and do not have blood.

This means that their body temperature is regulated internally and remains relatively constant. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because lizards and pythons are ectothermic, meaning their body temperature is determined by the external environment. Option (D) is obviously incorrect because rocks are inanimate objects and do not have biological functions.
